DataElement.preferredName: Neutrophil Count 1000 Recovery Occurrence Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to Indicate the number of days required for a neutrophil count to recover to at least 1000 per cubic millimeter.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Indicates a neutrophil count of at least 1000 per cubic millimeter._A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident._

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Indicates a neutrophil count of at least 1000 per cubic millimeter.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a neutrophil count of at least 1000 per cubic millimeter.

Property.preferredDefinition: gradual healing (through rest) after sickness or injury.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/16/09mn-per review, removed prop qual 'first' 'day'.12/04/09:Recurated using C70827 instead of C25746 per Robinette/Review Committee -CJL Changed back to C25746 from C70827 per Robinette/Review Committee. SW 5/12/10

ValueDomain.preferredName: Blood Cell Count Recovery Day Count
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A test to check the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a sample of blood.  Also called complete blood count (CBC)._A getting back or regaining._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Blood Cell Count Recovery Day Count
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A test to check the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a sample of blood.  Also called complete blood count (CBC).:A getting back or regaining.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a biospecimen.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Determining the number or amount of something.
